intro: Mesostemma platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaf mesostemma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers that bloom during the cooler months. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system that helps it access groundwater.
